thread.title: Haverhill field hockey nears first tourney berth in 19 years
thread.title_full: Haverhill field hockey nears first tourney berth in 19 years

author: Michael Muldoon mmuldoon@eagletribune.com
title: Haverhill field hockey nears first tourney berth in 19 years
text:
Haverhill field hockey nears first tourney berth in 19 years 
CARL RUSSO/Staff photo. Haverhill's Juanita Pardo, left, battles Lawrence's Lisbeth Carpio. Posted: Wednesday, October 21, 2015 12:00 am Haverhill field hockey nears first tourney berth in 19 years Michael Muldoon mmuldoon@eagletribune.com Eagle-Tribune 
HAVERHILL — The 2015 Haverhill High field hockey team has enjoyed one of the best seasons in the long-struggling program’s history. 
I dusted off our record books (which go back through the 1989 season) and here are some facts for the 8-5 Hillies, who still have four regular season games left. With one more win (or two ties), they’ll qualify for States for the third time in this 27-year span. 
The 1996 club went 9-5-3, the most wins in the last 27 years. 
Rookie coach Christopher Drew’s squad can equal (or beat) that modern wins record with regular season games left against Methuen, Lowell, Tewksbury and Georgetown then the possible state tourney berth. 
The Hillies beat Methuen 2-1, Lowell 2-0 and Georgetown 3-1 earlier in the season. 
The lone state tourney win in this 27-year span was a preliminary round game in 1995 to that’s another piece of history out there. 
The Hillies have gone 5-5 in the Merrimack Valley Conference and 3-0 in non-league play. They’ve had their struggles against some of the heavyweights of the MVC Large but are tied for first in the MVC Small. 
With another two wins this fall, the Hillies would equal their win total from the previous four years combined (10-48-7). 
The Hillie captains are seniors Gaby Ginn, Liz Brady, Lizzy Duchemin and Sydney Demarais. 
Brady has a team-high eight goals followed by Demarais and junior Cynthia Caruso with four apiece, Ginn with three, Duchemin and senior Juanita Pardo with two each and sophomore Jordyn O’Boyle with one. 
Senior Alex Comeau, a Southern New Hampshire University lacrosse goalie recruit, has been a standout in net. 
HAVERHILL THROUGH THE YEARS 
2015: 8-5 (4 regular season games left) 
2014: 3-12-3, didn’t make tourney 
2013: 2-13-3, didn’t make tourney 
2012: 3-11-1, didn’t make tourney 
2011: 2-12, didn’t make tourney 
2010: 4-10-2, didn’t make tourney 
2000-2009 seasons 
2009: 8-10, didn’t make tourney 
2008: 2-14-2, didn’t make tourney 
2007: 2-14, didn’t make tourney 
2006: 3-11-2, didn’t make tourney 
2005: 3-15, didn’t make tourney 
2004: 3-12-3, didn’t make tourney 
2003: 2-14-2, didn’t make tourney 
2002: 3-10-3, didn’t make tourney 
2001: 2-16, didn’t make tourney 
2000: 3-13-1, didn’t make tourney 
1989-1999 
1999: 5-13, didn’t make tourney 
1998: 2-14, didn’t make tourney 
1997: 3-12-1, didn’t make tourney 
1996: 9-5-3, lost in D1 North first round 
1995: 8-6-4, lost in D1 North first round (won a prelim round game) 
1994: didn’t make tourney 
1993: didn’t make tourney 
1992: didn’t make tourney 
1991: didn’t make tourney 
1990: didn’t make tourney 
1989: Didn’t make tourney Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
